title: Boston City Council shows mixed support for rent control ballot question
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Boston City Council debated but postponed voting on support for a 2026 rent control ballot measure.
Councilor Henry Santana's resolution faced opposition, with Councilor Ed Flynn calling for a public hearing on the issue.
Advocates aim to collect 75,000 signatures for the measure, which limits rent increases to cost of living changes, capped at 5%.

title: Haim praises Brick Street Bagels: ‘Bomb bagels’
author: Frances Klemm
bullets: Haim praised Brick Street Bagels in Boston, calling them 'bomb bagels' during an interview with WERS 88.9FM.
Brick Street Bagels, founded in 2022, is known for fresh, crunchy bagels and plans to open a permanent location in South Boston.
Haim promoted their album and performed in Boston, while Alana Haim filmed an A24 movie in the city last fall.

title: Thieves in Quincy are ordering pizzas then stealing the driver’s car, police say
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Two nearly identical car thefts targeting pizza delivery drivers occurred in Quincy in late August and early September.
In each incident, thieves placed fake pizza orders and stole the cars while the drivers were distracted.
Both stolen vehicles were recovered in nearby areas, and two men have been arrested in connection with the thefts.

title: Man allegedly made bomb threats to Everett city councilor
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Scott Merchant, 36, of Salisbury, pleaded not guilty to making bomb threats to an Everett city councilor.
The Boston FBI and Salisbury police acted on social media threats of firearms and explosives.
Merchant, charged with bomb/hijack threat, is set for a bail hearing; the investigation is ongoing.

title: Here’s why there are American flags above gates B32 and C19 at Boston Logan Airport
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: American flags at gates B32 and C19 at Logan Airport honor victims of the September 11, 2001 attacks.
American Airlines Flight 11 and United Airlines Flight 175 departed from these gates on September 11, 2001.
Flags were raised without ceremony by airport employees post-9/11; additional flags now fly at gates B11 and B27.

title: MassINC poll: Just over half of voters approve of Healey’s performance
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: A MassINC poll shows 56% of Massachusetts residents approve of Governor Maura Healey's performance.
Healey's strongest approval comes from Democrats, college educated voters, and women over 50, with the lowest support from Southeastern Mass.
By comparison, former Gov. Charlie Baker had a 68% approval rating in 2022, while Trump's approval is significantly lower in Massachusetts.

title: Where to find college student discounts in Greater Boston
author: Frances Klemm, Nia Harmon and Laura Emde
bullets: AMC Theatres offers student pricing at Boston Common, Assembly Row, and South Bay Center with a valid student ID.
American Repertory Theater provides $25 rush tickets and $30 advance tickets for students under 25 with ID.
The Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum and MFA offer free admission to students from member universities with student ID.

title: ‘It’s a cornerstone of who we are’: Read Rep. Lori Trahan’s letter to Market Basket board
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: U.S. Rep. Lori Trahan expresses disappointment over the firing of Market Basket CEO Arthur T. Demoulas.
Trahan's open letter highlights her personal connection to Market Basket, emphasizing its significance in her life.
The corporate shakeup follows tensions between Demoulas and his sisters, who hold a majority stake in the company.

title: What Jabrill Peppers said about his surprising release from the Patriots
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jabrill Peppers was released by the Patriots on cutdown day despite signing a contract extension last year.
Peppers joined the Pittsburgh Steelers, fulfilling his desire to play under coach Mike Tomlin before retirement.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel stated Peppers' release was in the team's best interest, despite acknowledging his respect for Peppers.

title: Mark Wahlberg is filming a new movie on the North Shore
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Mark Wahlberg is filming 'Weekend Warriors' in Lynn, Massachusetts, a movie co-produced by LeBron James for Apple TV+.
'Weekend Warriors', directed by Stephen Chbosky, follows a father and his autistic son visiting NBA teams across North America.
The film is based on the 2023 German movie 'Weekend Rebels', adapted from Mirco and Jason von Juterczenka's true story.
